title: The Parable of the Prodigal Son

sequence.summary: The younger son asks for his inheritance and leaves.
He squanders his inheritance in a distant country.
He recognizes his situation and decides to return home.
The father sees him and runs to embrace him.
The father restores him and celebrates his return.
The elder brother reacts with resentment.

emphases: The father as image of divine mercy
The homily of St. John Chrysostom on repentance
The spiritual meaning of returning from exile
doctrinal_links: Great Canon of St. Andrew of Crete

emphases: The initiative of the Father’s love
The father as model of divine compassion
Older brother motif paralleling Jonah and the Ninevites

discussion_prompts: What does 'coming to oneself' mean spiritually or psychologically?
How does the father model unconditional love?
Why is the older brother important?
Where do you personally locate yourself in this story today?

cognitive_tasks.description: Compare forgiveness in this parable with Joseph forgiving his brothers.
Write about a time you returned to something meaningful.
